value.description: The Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint is acting as a token mapping service.
value.name: tokenmapping

value.description: The Tivoli Federated Identity Manager endpoint is acting as an OAuth secure token service.
value.name: oauth

value.description: <p>Use the following namespace for all LTPA token versions:</p><ul><li>http://www.ibm.com/websphere/appserver/tokentype/5.0.2/#LTPA</li></ul>
value.name: static

value.description: <p>Use one of the following namespaces based on the LTPA token version:</p><ul><li>http://www.ibm.com/websphere/appserver/tokentype/5.0.2/#LTPA</li><li>http://www.ibm.com/websphere/appserver/tokentype/#LTPAv2</li></ul>
value.name: dynamic

property.name: mAdminState
property.label: Enable administrative state
property.summary: Set the administrative state of this configuration.
property.hoverhelp: <p>Set the administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set the check box.</li><li>To make inactive, clear the check box.</li></ul>
property.description: <p>The administrative state of the configuration.</p><ul><li>To make active, set to enabled.</li><li>To make inactive, set to disabled.</li></ul>

property.name: mEndpointType
property.description: Specify the endpoint type configured on the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mServerURL
property.description: Specify the domain-qualified host name or IP address of the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mServerPort
property.description: Specify the listening port on the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server.

property.name: mCompatibleMode
property.description: <p>Select the currently configured version of Tivoli Federated Identity Manager. The selected value determines the details for the namespace and WS-Trust messages.</p><ul><li>For versions 6.0 or 6.1, version 1.2 of the WS-Trust specification is used.</li><li>For version 6.2, version 1.3 of the WS-Trust specification is used, which corresponds to the "Validate OASIS URI" Request Type. Version 6.2 also supports WS-Trust 1.2. <p><b>Note:</b> To use WS-Trust 1.2 messages with a TFIM version 6.2 server, use 6.1 as the compatibility mode. On a TFIM version 6.2 server, this corresponds to the "Validate" Request Type.</p></li></ul>

property.name: mReqToken60Format
property.description: Select the format of the request token when using Tivoli Federated Identity Manager version 6.0.1.

property.name: mReqToken61Format
property.description: Select the format of the request token when using Tivoli Federated Identity Manager version 6.1.

property.name: mReqToken62Format
property.description: Select the format of the request token when using Tivoli Federated Identity Manager version 6.2.

property.name: mReqCustomURL
property.summary: Custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file for request.
property.description: When Request Token Format is Custom, upload the custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file to the DataPower Gateway. The custom stylesheet or GatewayScript file must be in the local: or store: directory.

property.name: mAppliesToAddress
property.description: <p>When Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the scope for this security token. For example, enter the services to which this token applies. For example:</p><ul><li>http://tfim.ibm.com:9080/EchoApplication/services/EchoServiceUsername</li><li>http://9.33.97.251:9080/EchoApplication/services/EchoServiceUsername</li></ul><p>Within the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager service, this information specifies the destination of the request. The TFIM trust service uses this information to determine which partner is being accessed.</p><p>To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your TFIM administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the AppliesTo field.</p>

property.name: mIssuer
property.description: <p>When Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the identity that issued the request. In the WS-Security Management (WSSM) component, the issuer is either the WSSM token generator or the WSSM token consumer. For example:</p><ul><li>urn:itfim:wssm:tokenconsumer</li></ul><p>To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your Tivoli Federated Identity Manager administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the <tt>Issuer</tt> field.</p>

property.name: mPortType
property.description: <p>When Compatibility Mode is version 6.1 or version 6.2 and when Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the Web services port type to use. A port type is a group of Web services operations. For example:</p><p><tt>EchoService</tt></p><p>To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your Tivoli Federated Identity Manager administrator. Within the WSDL document, this destination equates to the PortType field.</p>

property.name: mOperation
property.description: <p>When Compatibility Mode is version 6.1 or version 6.2 and when Request Token Format is not Custom, enter the name of the Web services operation as defined in the WSDL document. For example:</p><p><tt>echo</tt></p><p>To determine the correct value, consult either the WSDL document or your Tivoli Federated Identity Manager administrator.</p>

property.name: mSSLProxy
property.summary: The TLS proxy profile is deprecated. Use a TLS client profile.
property.description: Select the TLS proxy profile to manage TLS communications with the peer. The TLS Proxy Profile identifies the keys and certificates that are used in the handshake.

property.name: mSchemaValidate
property.description: Specify whether to schema-validate responses from the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager server. When enabled, responses are schema-validated using the WS-Trust version that is defined by the compatibility mode.

property.name: mLTPAValueTypeMode
property.summary: LTPA Binary Security Token Value Type
property.display: LTPA Binary Security Token Value Type
property.description: The namespace mode to use when populating the ValueType field of an LTPA BinarySecurityToken.

property.name: mSTSUsername
property.description: Basic authentication user name when connecting to the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager OAuth secure token service.

property.name: mSTSPassword
property.description: Basic authentication password when connecting to the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager OAuth secure token service.

property.name: mSTSPasswordAlias
property.description: Password alias for the Basic authentication password when connecting to the Tivoli Federated Identity Manager OAuth secure token service.

property.name: mSSLClientConfigType
property.summary: Set the TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS profile type to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.

property.name: mSSLClient
property.summary: Set the TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets
property.description: The TLS client profile to secure connections between the DataPower Gateway and its targets.
